info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 6:29PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nolan County through 700 PM CDT... At 629 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Champion, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Champion, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 608 And Highway 147 and I-20 Near The Nolan-Mitchell County Line. This includes Interstate 20 near Mile Marker 229. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
